title: Regular Seasonal Factors: Total Truck Production
notes:
A seasonal factor measures the percentage amount that on average, monthly production is above or below normal. A seasonal factor of 120 states that the month in question will usually be 20% above an average month's production level. Similarly, a seasonal factor of 100 implies an average month, while a factor of 80 implies a month that is typically 20% below average.

The not seasonally adjusted (NSA) data for total truck assemblies (https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/MVATRUCKSN) are obtained from Ward's Communications, and the seasonal factors (SF), which contain adjustments for holiday and length-of-month effects as well as normal seasonal variation, are applied to MVATRUCKSN (https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/MVATRUCKSN) using the formula found here (https://www.federalreserve.gov/releases/g17/mvsf.htm).
